Cool Frank maybe you should go. It would be a great chance to try out one of the new boxes and get some orders for the prototypes. Orders=$$ for new parts.
   
  Misty

Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
  This is close to my home, at teh Stanley Motel. I probably won't go, I need 
to spend too much for parts. I found this through the Ghost Village.



>
>Calling All Ghost Hunters and Ghost Lovers,
>
>The National Ghost Hunters Getaway is proud to present
>
>“The Shining” Investigation
>
>January 27th & 28th 2007
>
>Join professional, amateur hunters and just plain ghost lovers as they 
>investigate the Stanley Hotel in Estes Park, CO. This magnificent Hotel was 
>the inspiration to Stephen King’s “The Shining” and he himself spent time 
>there developing his horrific nightmare, that we still enjoy today. Granted 
>the spirits in his award winning book are more on the devilish side. The 
>hotel does house some of the less life threatening spooks and has possibly 
>done so shortly after its opening in 1909. This amazing structure offers 
>the ghost hunters a late night investigation as we venture into it’s 
>darkened halls and closed down facilities. The night may hold an eerie 
>silent chill, but who’s to say some spirits are just dieing to speak to an 
>unsuspecting ghost hunter. So spend the weekend learning what other ghost 
>hunters do, collecting evidence, sharing your findings or just make new 
>paranormal friends as we investigate the ghosts of Haunted Stanley Hotel.
>
>
>Tickets for this event are $35 per person
>
>Rooms are $99 a night (double occupancy) for this special event
>So please remember to let them know you are with the Ghost Hunters Getaway
>
>You will be responsible for your our own travel and hotel arrangements.
>
>More details and event are being scheduled, so please feel free to contact 
>AGHOST at
>
>Phone: 253 203-4383 or email Theresaghost@...
>
>_________________________________________________________________

_________________________________________________________________
